Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 10:49AM SalemMom wrote: I am new here.  December 23rd I had both off.  New to all of this.  I saw surgeon on December 17th - surgery was December 23rd!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 11:02AM SalemMom wrote: I too had a mamogram, with dense breasts, which 3 radiologists said was fine - even though my mammo tech ex sister-in-law said 'it didn't look right'.  But---she was only a tech and radiologists said it was 'nothing'.  Thanksgiving day it was 'something'.  Tumor.  Invasive Ductal Carcinoma.  Everyone with dense breasts should be routinely given an ultrasound.  Period.  I could have dealt with this back in August.  Starting chemo after I heal from BM which was on 12/23.  The port feels tight and funky but, whatever.  I can't believe how many people i know around me who have it or had it also.  I have a CAT scan Friday since 3 of 13 lymph nodes were involved.  Best wishes to everyone everywhere!  Let's beat this!
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 10:52AM SalemMom wrote: hi there, I agree the port can be weird feeling at times.  esp during the healing of a masectomy.   My diagnosis and surgery has been rapid fire.  I have 5 kids - so I can empathize with how busy you must be.  IDC
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer

Posts.Content: Jan 5, 2011 11:05AM SalemMom wrote: Zogo - hi!  At first I found that I didn't want to think about it - but I think writing here helps.  I am right there with you in the whole mess of second guessing treatment, being new to this - and wondering what it all means!!  I have no family history, am healthy, a 'normal' mammogram 4 months ago and now very confused.  ugh.....  But I am hopeful.  I have 5 kids who need me - I am a single mom. And I just finished my Masters Degree when I found the lump.  So much for life going back to normal.  (Whatever NORMAL IS!  lol)
Posts.Title: December 2010 Mastectomy zogo fire-dancer
